游戏很好玩，玩家也很友善。
1 人类在门口连续按ctrl，屠夫会热情的把你送出门口。
2 有些屠夫会把人类挂上钩，身体会贴在人类身上，显示出就算不同阵营也可以亲密无间
3 游戏内人类经常可以解锁一些特殊头像比如“插头”头像，就很受欢迎。
 我TM的真的太爱这个游戏了

I think we did a pretty good job so far.

My favorite game by far. Bloody good fun...literally. 
Yeah, sometimes queue times are long (especially later in the night). And yeah some people are nasty in post game chats, but if you've ever wanted to be in a slasher movie, or cut someone's finger off to add to your collection, or t-bag Michael Myers - this the game for you, m8.

I've played Dead By Daylight on and off for nearly 2 years, and i gotta say..

everytime i get a phase where i play for mulitple hours daily i just fall in love with this game over and over again. Although we've all experienced quite a handful of bugs in the combined thousands of games we played in DBD, right now it feels really polished and well balanced. I can grind hours upon hours of solo survivor games, say "hey cuties" in a lobby everytime and meet one of the friendliest players in the entire internet. Sure there are some bad apples, but overall the Dead By Daylight community is more than wholesome! 

There is nothing more beautiful, than playing an intense game of DBD, running the killer around for a couple of minutes, to then sacrifise yourself and get saved as a thank you. I've probably spent nearly a quarter of my ingame time, hanging out in after game lobbies, chatting with my teammates after a perfectly executed teamplay, while not being able to talk to each other whatsoever.

Yeah playing killer is also okay x)

Gameplay: 9/10 Teamplay: 10/10 Wholesome Community: 69/10

I've played Dead by Daylight for a few hundred hours now, around 300, I believe, and I would say the game is a solid 3.5/5. Dead by Daylight is, at base, an asymmetric horror game that pits a team of four survivors against one powerful killer. The survivors rely on quick wit, teamwork, and dumb luck to repair five generators, then escape the trial grounds that they are currently in. Both killers and survivors can obtain and use unique perks, items, and add-ons to make things easier for themselves or more difficult for the other side. 
Currently, I wouldn't say that there are many imbalances in overall game play, save for a notable few perks and items, such as Decisive Strike, a teachable survivor perk from Laurie Strode, or Judith's Tombstone, an iridescent, iridescent being the highest quality and rarest type of item/add-on, add-on for the Shape. However, despite some glaringly unbalanced stick-outs the game is predominantly well balanced and these majorly imbalanced perks/add-ons will not effect your game play often.
Now fun game play, decent balancing, and an interesting overall concept may seem to have merited a low score of 3.5/5, but there is a reason: a startling swath of mechanical errors, or as us gamers like to call them, glitches.Dead by Daylight is rife with glitches including, but not limited to: random disconnections from lobbies, intractable game elements that spawn in places where players can not reach them, a number of, admittedly hilarious, visual glitches that can cause survivors to appear to fly or turn characters completely invisible, and my personal favorite, an error that occurs when a pallet stun, a mechanic that allows survivors to briefly stun the killer while being chased by dropping a wooden pallet on them, causes the killer to glitch and sink into the earth, rendering the killer completely immobile for the remainder of the match.  
All things considered, I would by Dead by Daylight only if it was on sale and do enjoy killing a few odd hours on it here and there. If Dead by Daylight is on sale and you have ten dollars to throw away for a few hours worth of entertainment, I'd say 'go for it.' Overall, Dead by Daylight is a solid and enjoyable 3.5/5 game.
